result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael George Stoehr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

$250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.
Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.

Absolute sobriety.

No drugs without a prescription and only in amount prescribed. 

No drug paraphernalia.

No alcohol.

Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.
May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor.

Must successfully complete St. Croix County Treatment Court Program. 

Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

records.addlTxt:
11:12 AM  Defendant Michael George Stoehr in court.  Attorney Nicholas R White in court for Michael George Stoehr. Attorney Holly D. Wood Webster in court for the State of Wisconsin. RL-clerk. Atty White recites agreement. ADA to file amended information. Felony warnings given re no possession of firearms, loss of voting rights, etc. On amended ct 1- def- G plea. CT accepts plea, adj G. Count 2 RI&D on state's motion. Def requests to waive PSI. CT finds waiver is made FK&V. 

SENTENCE: W/held sent 3 years probation. $290.60 fine/cost, $250 DNA surcharge and sample. 60 dtp or set up PP with COCC.  AS. No drugs without a prescription, no para, no alcohol. AODA and comply. Must successfully complete St Croix County Treatment Court program. Must report to Probation today. 2 days credit if revoked. PCR. May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor. Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights. 11:29 am adj.

Status conference on June 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Warrant Cancellation - In custody of St. Croix Co.  St. Croix Co advsd they have subject incustody.

1:15 PM. JL-Clerk. Defendant Michael George Stoehr appeared by video, in custody. Atty Donna Burger in court for Def. Prosecuting attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for the State of Wisconsin. CT quashes warrant. CT reinstates signature bond. Bond cont. 1:19 pm adj.
Preliminary hearing on April 22, 2022 at 08:45 am.
